alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Judith Basin; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 08 at 1:59PM MST until March 08 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches at lower elevations, with 4 to 9 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Lewis and Clark County and the Rocky Mountain Front, Cascade, and Judith Basin. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A brief period of heavy snow is expected at the onset of the snow. Rapid accumulations and a flash freeze will likely accompany this heavy snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

area.areaDesc: Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Judith Basin; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
